body:
I don't think rclone does any credential refreshes when uploading to s3 - that is all done in the SDK if required.

What sort of credentials are you using that need refreshing?

We use the AssumeRole API to distribute tightly-scoped credentials to the service instances that have embedded rclone, and they typically expire after 1 hour.  The AWS SDK and rclone seems to do the right thing in other code paths, such as when uploading the individual multipart chunks.  But there seems to be a missing link in the initialize multipart upload code and the refresh isn't triggered.  I was wondering if it might be some problematic interaction between the fact that rclone turns off the AWS SDK retry mechanism in favor of its own retry logic, but that the way in which AWS is reporting this condition (TokenExpired/HTTP 400) is not being correctly retried which would presumably perform token refresh.

The minimum credential lifetime that AWS will return is 15 minutes, so it's a bit tricky to reproduce consistently.

> We use the AssumeRole API to distribute tightly-scoped credentials to the service instances that have embedded rclone, and they typically expire after 1 hour. The AWS SDK and rclone seems to do the right thing in other code paths, such as when uploading the individual multipart chunks.

OK

> But there seems to be a missing link in the initialize multipart upload code and the refresh isn't triggered.

I looked at the code and I don't think it does anything special/different. Can you see a difference?

> I was wondering if it might be some problematic interaction between the fact that rclone turns off the AWS SDK retry mechanism in favor of its own retry logic, but that the way in which AWS is reporting this condition (TokenExpired/HTTP 400) is not being correctly retried which would presumably perform token refresh.

Hmm, that sounds possible. Maybe you could enable AWS SDK retries and try it and see what happens. S3 is so reliable anyway it is unlikely to cause a problem in the short term to have each rclone retry retried by the SDK.

> The minimum credential lifetime that AWS will return is 15 minutes, so it's a bit tricky to reproduce consistently.

It's a bit tricky to try to follow the full code path, but this unit test seems to be pretty clear in laying out the expectation that the SDK needs to retry in order to trigger credential refresh:
https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/blob/main/aws/request/request_test.go#L282

I see two possible ways forward here:
1. Enable retry on the AWS SDK side.  I'm not clear on what the motivation was for disabling this and relying on rclone's retry - it seems like this would imply code duplication since the SDK already has extensive semantics for what it should retry.
2. Add this case to rclone's retry logic.

It is definitely interesting to me that the SDK has several more retry paths declared here that are effectively ignored by the more limited retry semantics from the S3 rclone backend:
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/a5f277f47e597aece7829aac4f1a796a700e563a/backend/s3/s3.go#L1427-L1431

Here is why we turned off the AWS SDK retries dc06973796392edfa613a053f899ef869134c388

----
s3: use rclone's low level retries instead of AWS SDK to fix listing retries
 
 In 5470d34740d03e15 "backend/s3: use low-level-retries as the number
 of SDK retries" we switched over to using the AWS SDK low level
 retries instead of rclone's low level retry logic.
 
 This had the unfortunate attempt that retrying listings to correct XML
 Syntax errors failed on non S3 backends such as CEPH. The AWS SDK was
 also retrying the XML Syntax error request which doesn't make sense.
 
 This change turns off the AWS SDK retries in favour of just using
 rclone's retry logic.

----

This is a very similar case to the the AWS SDK using retries to refresh tokens - rclone uses retries to figure out the format of directory listings.

I've reverted that commit in this branch and then made us do 2 rclone retries and the normal number (10 by default) of s3 retries. Can you see if this fixes your problem?

[v1.57.0-beta.5623.7654e0950.fix-5509-s3-retries](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5509-s3-retries/v1.57.0-beta.5623.7654e0950.fix-5509-s3-retries/) on branch [fix-5509-s3-retries](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5509-s3-retries) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I've been trying to reproduce this in the context of a controlled development environment and so far I've been unable to trigger the bug; I know it's lurking there as I've seen it a number of times in our production environments, but there's platform splay to contend with.  I'll keep trying and update here once I either have a reliable reproduction or if I can't manage to get it to appear under controlled circumstances.
@macklin-10x just trying to decide whether to merge this fix - do you think it is good?
I was unable to reproduce the bug in a controlled environment, so unfortunately I can't provide any feedback as to whether it addresses the issue we were having.  I do suspect it would, though.

Thanks for the update @macklin-10x 

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.57
